title: i might suck at this game but i'm pretty successful irl
body: i won a gift card in a contest once.

replies.body: What is this Irl you speak of? Is this a new gamemode?
it's pay to win though
there's an 18 years free trial
heard its available on steam
no, its available by going outside.
its also available on steam, it's categorized as an mmo, massively multiplayer outside.
Graphics are amazing, gameplay not so much.
But characters are bad designed. Most of them have no personality and aren't interesting enough. Also I think they are bugged, since most characters fight and kill each other.
I may not get fed in-game, but at least I get fed IRL. {{item:3070}}

I won a Lego Mindstorms NXT set once.

I'm higher elo

> [{quoted}](name=Hatch RawerBeryl,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=Q5FA10xj,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-08-13T05:22:07.880+0000)
>
> I won a Lego Mindstorms NXT set once.
> 
> I'm higher elo

Overachiever

_Always_ have to be better than someone else, DON'T YOU

shame on you

I just love it when you don't do so well in a game and someone on the other team has the nerves to say somelike like
You suck, must be some 13 year old in middle school ROFLMAO. 
You can't be an adult who has a full time job and just plays a game as a hobby?
well im an adult with a full time job who plays the game as a hobby....and i assume when i see people who suck and/or are toxic about how bad they are that they are kids
And you are Bronze V lol
and your point is? there's kids worse then bronze 5

I never said that they are toxic. I just said they suck.
Not to be mean, but you kind of prove my point. 
That you can have a full time job and play league of legends as a hobby. Doesn't mean you have to put ten hours in every day. 
But it just really gets me mad when people think that just because you aren't plat/diamond, that you must be a young child playing a game, and not be someone who plays the game once or twice a day as a hobby or fun activity, someone who cant spend the time needed to be "good".

For what it's worth I actually have the opposite perspective. I'm finishing a BS at a respected university, have a job, and am generally successful as an adult. Everyone I know that plays league and is bronze/silver/gold is 20+ years old. The only plat player I know if in real life is 13 and is my friends little brother. So for me.. people in diamond/plat are the children, by definition. That's not intended to be disrespectful, just my personal observation and experience. My theory is younger people have faster reflexes and maybe have an easier time focusing... also maybe more time to devote to the game?
Just funny how a player from the lowest division of the whole game think he can judge whether someone "sucks" at this game.

I may have bad behaviour in game but I am a really nice guy irl.

My dog loves me.
If your dog loves you, I love you. Dogs know the truth.
I may not dunk on League, but I almost dunked a basketball once and I'm 6'1"

You're playing a 6'1" character?

Pfft, you try-hard.
Gotta get those Cho stacks!
this earned my upvote
...+ 1  OP  made me smile ;)
I won a cake walk once.
and they work from the comfort of their home in their warm pajamas!
I was once 10 off when guessing how many jelly beans were in a jar, so um... yeah. lol
lol
